private_information: I may only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A, I, E
I can only interact with a block that is currently at the top of a stack
I may move exactly one block at a time and place it either on the table or onto the top of another stack
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table.

private_information: I may only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: H, C, F, J, G, B, D
I can only interact with a block that is currently at the top of a stack
I may move exactly one block at a time and place it either on the table or onto the top of another stack
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on top of B, B is on top of C, C is on top of D, D is on top of E, E is on top of F, F is on top of G, G is on top of H, H is on top of I, I is on top of J, and J is on the table.

public_information: There are ten uniquely labeled blocks: A, I, E, H, C, F, J, G, B, D
Initial stacks are: Stack1 bottom A then E then C then G then B on top, Stack2 bottom H then J on top, Stack3 bottom I then F then D on top
All other positions are empty table positions
Agents may only move the block that is currently at the top of a stack
One agent may only move vowel-labelled blocks and the other may only move consonant-labelled blocks
Each move consists of picking one top block and placing it either on the table or on top of another stack
Only one block can be moved at a time

observe.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. Using the public information and your private knowledge about which blocks you can manipulate, produce a concise structured report describing which stacks currently have vowel top-blocks you can legally move, which moves are legal for you now, and any local ordering constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on capabilities, legal single-block moves, and limitations.
observe.prompt: Your identity is vowel_agent. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Here is your goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a concise structured report of the top blocks you can move, the set of legal target placements for each movable block, and any observations that will help an orchestrator integrate your capabilities into a joint plan.

observe.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. Using the public information and your private knowledge about which blocks you can manipulate, produce a concise structured report describing which stacks currently have consonant top-blocks you can legally move, which moves are legal for you now, and any local ordering constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on capabilities, legal single-block moves, and limitations.
observe.prompt: Your identity is consonant_agent. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Here is your goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a concise structured report of the top blocks you can move, the set of legal target placements for each movable block, and any observations that will help an orchestrator integrate your capabilities into a joint plan.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent PDDL modelling and producing planning problems for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the reports from vowel_agent and consonant_agent. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that encode the two agents as distinct actors with disjoint action permissions, model top-of-stack constraints, and the initial and goal configurations. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards and include any required :requirements and typing necessary for a classical STRIPS-style planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Name actions with an agent prefix to keep them distinct, for example move-vowel or move-consonant.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the structured observations from the two agents: {obs_vowel} and {obs_consonant}. Your task is to integrate their local observations and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem file that solve the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Ensure agent-specific action preconditions enforce which agent can move which letter, ensure only top blocks can be moved, and ensure single-block moves. Keep agent actions distinct and the encoding solvable by the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
